Name: Cypriot vase
Description: This terracotta vase was found at Abydos during the excavations of the Egypt Exploration Fund in 1912-1913. It is characterised by a belly which is round at the front and oval at the sides, and by a long neck equipped with a large rounded rim. This type of receptacle, of which the form is of cypriot inspiration, is probably a near eastern import. It dates from the New Kingdom.
